param.name: InputTable
param.dialogReference: Layer or table view which contains incidence and population data aggregated by region and if applicable, age group.

param.name: InputTableFields
param.expression: Region ID {Event Count} {Population Count};Region ID {Event Count} {Population Count}...
param.dialogReference:
Fields with the following specifications

  • Region ID: String or integer uniquely identifying each geographic area

  • Event Count: Integer number of events in region among total population or if applicable, age group

  • Population Count: Integer population within region among total population or if applicable, age group

param.name: InputFeature
param.dialogReference: Polygon feature of geographic areas within the input table

param.name: InputFeatureField
param.dialogReference: String or integer field uniquely identifying each geographic area

param.name: OutputTable
param.dialogReference: Output dataset that will contain stabilized rates.

param.name: AgeGroupField
param.dialogReference:
Field designating age groups.

The following are valid age groups: ["0-4", "5-14", "15-24", "25-34", "35-44", "45-54", "55-64", "65-74", "75-84", "85up"]

param.name: StandardPopulationYear
param.dialogReference: Standard population year used to adjust rate

param.name: StandardizedAgeGroups
param.expression: {Lower age value {Upper age value};Lower age value {Upper age value}...}
param.dialogReference:
Designates lower and upper bounds of age groups that will be standardized.

The following example would generate age standardized rates for individuals 35 to 64, 65 and up, and 35 and up:

Lower age value Upper age value

35 64

65 85up

35 85up

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by Ryan Zomorrodi, May. 2024. @ CEHI, University of Illinois Chicago.
